1: Don't go out of your way to hurt people.
2: No discussion of controversial topics, namely religion and politics. Also no suicide topics, it can get many people sad about it and offended, we aren't trained professionals to help you.
3: Don't demand to be handed code/models/etc . You may find someone to work for you in the appropriate channels (<#438390049457831950>,  <#438390585536020501>).
4:
No advertising outside of the appropriate channel (<#438386950836060171>). Showcasing is fine if it is done within the correct channels.
Advertising of unrelated Discord servers is not allowed.
5: No porn. <#438391730379685929> is meant for nsfw games, not your hentai collection.
6:
Don't ask to ask. "How do you add two ints in C++?" is much better than "Can someone help me?"
Don't ask in <#243005537342586880>. There are appropriate channels for that in the development category. Go to <#438388535574396938> if there isn't a channel for your question topic.
7: When posting to <#438390737957158913> , <#438390049457831950> and <#438390585536020501> provide as many details as you possibly can. Work is a serious thing and competent people don't go in blindfolded.
8: No piracy links or anything that goes against Discord's TOS. You can talk about piracy and pirated software, just don't mention any websites.
9: When posting into <#430007747031859201> or <#438386950836060171> you may only post once per week. Any duplicate posts will be deleted without notice.
10: Before asking how to fix your issues please Google it first, and show effort in solving it by yourself and understand what you did. We aren't here to spoonfeed you.
